problem.p: It is possible to specify user-defined constants and functions. Here, we add a constant tau (= 2*pi), and also define the Heaviside step function H(x). You can also specify an unknown function, for which we sample a well-behaved random function. In the following example, the answer is "H(x)*f''(tau)", where f'' is a random function.

User-defined functions often don't render quite right when using textline inputs. For example, try typing in "1/H(x)" in the box above. If you make extensive use of user-defined functions, we suggest incorporating those functions into the AsciiMath renderer definitions file we provide. See the documentation for details.
